timeline.bodyText: Can we exit early if this isn't true?
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: Yes. That was actually true even before this PR
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

timeline.bodyText: rare race condition here: col.getDecks().get(node.getDid()) could be deleted, in this case, we check the default deck multiple times.
timeline.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText: @Nullable. But, should we return an empty list here?
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
Before and after this PR it is null only if there is an exception after two tries, with one second between both try. I believe that it's nice that "null" and empty list have distinct meaning, i.e. error and no element founds.
I see no reason to change the return value in case of error here, the current choice in master seems good to me
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

timeline.bodyText: Can we return early if we don't have the intended extra.
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: We probably can, as long as we check that there is no ETRXA_dECK_ID either
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

replies.bodyText: See Mike's comment below - maybe will happen on an upgrade path
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: Looking at this again, I presume we'd want to cancel the alarm if it's invalid
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: I believe that is exactly what is happening below. If we can't find the deck option, the intent is created again and then the alarm manager get told that this intent is cancelled
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

replies.bodyText:
I'm gold-plating here, but there's a slight concern that we don't cancel intents that we weren't expecting.
Looks good to go then
replies.author: david-allison-1

timeline.message: early return if no extra EXTRA_DECK_OPTION_ID

timeline.bodyText: Can be inverted to reduce nesting
timeline.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText: Could you add a comment to note that this also explicitly excludes dynamic decks
timeline.author: david-allison-1
david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: Nice catch. Really sorry, I have trouble remembering to check comments
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

timeline.author: david-allison-1
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -103,20 +140,25 @@ public static Intent getReviewDeckIntent(@NonNull Context context, long deckId)
 
 
     // getDeckDue information, will recur one time to workaround collection close if recur is true

replies.bodyText: Done. And one other comment corrected too
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

timeline.message:
NF: one intent by deck option

We still use deck intent to let the user decide which deck to
review. However, the remainder receive a deck option instead of a
deck, so that it does all work simultaneously for each deck with the
same deck option

TODO: do a single reminder if multiple elements have same hours
NF: exit early from reminder if notifications not enabled

Cancel deck reminder

Since we don't want to deal with them anymore, let us clean the
reminders and ensure they are removed from the system
early return if no extra EXTRA_DECK_OPTION_ID
early return if no extra EXTRA_DECK_OPTION_ID
